title: All 13 Canadian premiers head to D.C. to battle Trump tariffs
author: CBC News
summary: All 13 Canadian premiers, led by Ontario's Doug Ford, are traveling to Washington to meet with U.S. lawmakers to argue against punitive tariffs that could harm both countries' economies. The premiers are concerned about the potential damage these tariffs could cause and are working together to make their case to protect their economies. The CBC provides accessible products for all Canadians, including those with visual, hearing, motor, and cognitive challenges, with closed captioning and described video options available for many shows on CBC Gem.

title: North Korea condemns Trump’s Gaza takeover plan as ‘slaughter, robbery’
author: Al Jazeera
content: North Korean state media has accused the US of slaughter and robbery over President Donald Trumps proposed plan to occupy the Gaza Strip and expel its population of more than two million Palestinians… [+2836 chars]
summary: North Korea has criticized the US for its proposed plan to occupy the Gaza Strip and expel its Palestinian population, calling it an act of "slaughter and robbery." The Korean Central News Agency (KCNA) accused the US of hegemonic ambitions and encroaching upon the sovereignty of other nations. President Trump confirmed his intention to displace over two million Palestinians from Gaza without allowing them to return, aiming to transform the territory into the "Riviera of the Middle East." This move has been condemned by human rights groups as ethnic cleansing. North Korea has been vocal in its criticism of US actions, including its recent accusation of posing a grave threat to North Korea's national security due to the presence of a US nuclear submarine in South Korea.

title: Why a trade surplus could mean a steel tariff exemption for Australia from Donald Trump
author: Georgie Hewson
content:
US President Donald Trump has said he will consider an exemption for Australia to his planned  25 per cent tariffs on steel and aluminium imports. 
As the president ramps up his trade warfare with t… [+5888 chars]
summary: US President Donald Trump is considering exempting Australia from planned tariffs on steel and aluminum imports due to a trade surplus. The trade surplus means Australia exports more than it imports from the US. Prime Minister Anthony Albanese had a positive conversation with Trump, advocating for an exemption. Economists note that bilateral trade deficits or surpluses don't provide a complete picture of trade relationships. Despite Trump's initial stance against exemptions, Australia is making a case for one based on their beneficial economic relationship with the US. Tariffs can impact prices of imported goods and are considered trade barriers. The text discusses the implications of tariffs, exemptions granted to other countries, and the potential impact on various industries.

title: Why are gold prices soaring amid US President Trump’s tariffs?
author: Al Jazeera Staff
content:
United States President Donald Trumps tariffs some threatened, others executed have sent global markets into a tizzy, pushing down several currencies.
But some things have become costlier, especiall… [+5519 chars]
summary: Gold prices have surged due to fears of trade wars and geopolitical uncertainty. President Trump's tariffs have impacted global markets, with some currencies falling while gold prices rise. Gold is considered a safe asset during times of uncertainty, retaining its value over time due to its scarcity and universal usability. Trump's recent tariffs on steel and aluminum imports have further fueled the rise in gold prices. The history of gold as a safe asset is highlighted, with examples such as the 2008 financial crisis and recent global events contributing to its value. Trump's tariffs have sparked concerns about inflation and retaliation from trading partners, impacting global markets and currencies.

title: Trump administration battles employee lawsuit to block dismantling of USAID
author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER, LINDSAY WHITEHURST
content: WASHINGTON (AP) The Trump administration will present an unforgiving argument for dismantling the U.S. Agency for International Development to a federal judge Wednesday: USAID is rife with insubordin… [+4636 chars]
summary: Protesters gathered outside the U.S. Agency for International Development following moves by Elon Musk and President Donald Trump to dismantle the agency. Affidavits from staffers and accounts from U.S. officials describe chaos at USAID, with senior leadership removed and funding frozen. Musk's teams are overseeing the termination of aid programs abroad without proper documentation. USAID workers in Congo were left stranded and in danger due to the agency's gutting. Affidavits also detail confusion and uncertainty among USAID workers as programs were abruptly canceled. The administration defends its actions, citing insubordination within USAID, while employees and supporters argue that the agency's humanitarian work is essential to national security. Legal battles are ongoing to challenge the dismantling of USAID.

title: Taxes douanières : Trump saborde les fondements historiques du commerce mondial
author: Richard Hiault
content: Après avoir imposé par décret une hausse des droits de douane sur les importations d'acier et d'aluminium, Donald Trump s'apprête dans les prochains jours à préciser les contours de sa nouvelle strat… [+4028 chars]
summary: Donald Trump has increased tariffs on steel and aluminum imports through a decree and is expected to provide more details on his new strategy in the coming days.

title: Trump readies matching tariffs on trade partners, possibly setting up a major economic showdown
author: JOSH BOAK
content: WASHINGTON (AP) President Donald Trump is taking additional action to upset the world trade system, with plans to sign an order as soon as Wednesday that would require that U.S. tariffs on imports ma… [+4655 chars]
summary: President Trump plans to sign an order aligning U.S. tariffs with those of other countries, aiming for reciprocity in trade. This move could impact the U.S. economy significantly, potentially leading to higher costs for consumers and businesses. Trump's approach diverges from previous administrations, as he seeks to increase taxes on imports to boost government revenue. The order could trigger retaliatory measures from trading partners, causing disruptions in global growth and trade relationships. Despite Trump's intentions to address issues like illegal immigration and drug trafficking, concerns remain about the potential consequences of his tariff policies. Analysts predict that this is just the beginning of a series of tariff announcements under Trump's administration, with implications for economic growth, inflation, and Federal Reserve policies.

title: Carol Paton | Rush to Washington a fool's errand as Trump sets impossible demands
author: Carol Paton
content: Trump has set demands that an ANC-led government could not possibly meet. Now is not the time to try to "explain" SA's position, writes Carol Paton.
summary: The text highlights that Trump has established demands that a government led by the African National Congress (ANC) in South Africa would find difficult to fulfill. The author, Carol Paton, argues that it is not the right time to justify or clarify South Africa's stance on these demands.

title: Trump SBA Tells Staff It Didn’t Mean to Fire Them, Then Fires Them the Next Day
author: Josh Eidelson
content: President Donald Trumps Small Business Administration told probationary staff members it had mistakenly sent them termination notices, and then informed some of them the next day that they were fired… [+220 chars]
summary: The Small Business Administration under President Donald Trump mistakenly sent termination notices to probationary staff members, only to later inform some of them that they were indeed fired.

title: Donald Trump wants to release the remaining classified JFK assassination records. Here is why it's happening now
author: Luke Cooper
content: United States President Donald Trump has been briefed on the potential release of classified records relating to the assassinations of former US president John F Kennedy, his brother Robert F Kennedy… [+13552 chars]
summary: The text discusses the potential release of classified records related to the assassinations of former US President John F. Kennedy, his brother Robert F. Kennedy, and civil rights leader Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has found around 2,400 new documents related to JFK's assassination, which are being transferred to the US National Archives. President Donald Trump signed an executive order to declassify these records, sparking interest in uncovering more details about these historical events. The text also mentions various theories and controversies surrounding the assassinations and highlights the potential impact of releasing the remaining classified files. Overall, the focus is on the significance of these events in US history and the ongoing quest for the truth.

title: US schoolteacher Marc Fogel released by Russia, White House says
author: Al Jazeera
content:
Russia has released Marc Fogel, an American teacher that Washington deemed to be wrongfully detained, after three and half years in prison, the White House has announced.
Fogel, 63, had been detaine… [+1729 chars]
summary: American teacher Marc Fogel, 63, was released by Russia after being wrongfully detained for possession of medical marijuana. The release was secured through negotiations by US President Donald Trump and special envoy Steve Witkoff. The nature of the exchange was not specified, but it was described as a gesture of goodwill from Russia towards ending the war in Ukraine. Fogel's family expressed gratitude for his return, and Trump mentioned that the US did not give up much for the release. Trump has previously expressed intentions to end the war in Ukraine quickly, but his plans remain unclear. Fogel's release follows previous exchanges of Americans for Russians, but there was no immediate comment from Moscow on this particular case.

title: Freed American hostage Marc Fogel lands in US after years in Russian captivity
author: Landon Mion
content:
Marc Fogel, an American who had been detained in Russia since 2021, landed back in the U.S. on Tuesday.
Fogel, a history teacher who was working at the Anglo-American School in Moscow, returned to t… [+2308 chars]
summary: American teacher Marc Fogel, who was detained in Russia since 2021, returned to the U.S. after his release and called President Donald Trump and his team 'heroes.' Fogel, a history teacher, was serving a 14-year sentence for possession of medically prescribed marijuana. He met with Trump at the White House and expressed his gratitude, stating that Trump, diplomats, senators, and representatives involved in his release are heroes. Fogel's family thanked Trump for his leadership in securing his release. The U.S. and Russia negotiated an exchange for Fogel's release, with Trump mentioning that the U.S. did not give up much in return. Fogel expressed feeling lucky and grateful for his return to American soil.

title: Trump hostage envoy says another American coming home "tomorrow"
author: Anna Commander
content:
The U.S.'s Envoy for Hostages, Adam Boehler, revealed that a second American is "coming in tomorrow" while discussing Marc Fogel's return to the U.S. on Tuesday.
Newsweek reached out to the State De… [+1573 chars]
summary: Anna Commander is a Newsweek Editor and writer based in Florida, focusing on crime, weather, and breaking news. She has covered major events in South Florida and previously worked at The National Desk and CBS12 News. Anna is a Florida Atlantic University graduate and can be contacted via email. The text discusses the return of Marc Fogel, an American detained in Russia, with President Trump's involvement in negotiating his release. Fogel was arrested for carrying cannabis prescribed in the U.S. for chronic pain, sentenced to 14 years in a Russian prison, and exchanged for another American. Various politicians and figures commented on Fogel's return, with plans for further diplomatic efforts in Ukraine. Newsweek emphasizes factual and fair journalism.

title: US aid freeze sets back fight against human trafficking in Cambodia
author: HUIZHONG WU
content: BANGKOK (AP) President Donald Trumps freeze on foreign assistance has dealt a blow to organizations fighting human trafficking and forced labor in Cambodia, where tens of thousands of people are held… [+6626 chars]
summary: The text discusses the impact of President Trump's freeze on foreign assistance on organizations fighting human trafficking and forced labor in Cambodia. It highlights how people are trafficked and forced to work in online scams, with some being lured under false pretenses. The freeze has affected rescue efforts, shelter operations, and programs aimed at preventing human trafficking. The Caritas shelter, a crucial facility providing care and support to victims, faces financial strain due to the funding freeze. The text also mentions the challenges faced by victims who manage to escape scam compounds, such as difficulties in returning home and the risk of being trafficked again. The funding freeze has led to the cancellation of various related programs and research efforts, impacting efforts to combat human trafficking in the region.
